sentences.english: Great genes, I muttered to myself.
sentences.chinese: 我不禁喃喃自語，果然是強大的基因。

sentences.english: Sometime what he mutters sounds nothing and elusive.
sentences.chinese: 有時候他好像喃喃自語，內容空洞而不著邊際。

sentences.english: The week mutters after the gentleman, orotund cheap oneself have to can only hear to pure.
sentences.chinese: 周繼君喃喃自語着，聲音低得只有自己能聽清。

sentences.english: "It's a battle without any organization, " mumbles another.
sentences.chinese: “這是一個沒有任何組織戰鬥，”喃喃自語另一個。

sentences.english: "You really need to be strong, " she mutters as she walks.
sentences.chinese: “你真的要堅強起來，”瑪扎爾邊走邊喃喃自語到。

sentences.english: “It will be my professional grave, ” he muttered to himself.
sentences.chinese: “它會是我的職業墳墓，”他喃喃自語道。

sentences.english: The week mutters after the gentleman, orotund low oneself must can only listen to pure.
sentences.chinese: 周繼君喃喃自語着，聲音低得只有自己能聽清。

sentences.english: Now mumble something quietly and play with your hair.
sentences.chinese: 現在卻又安靜的喃喃自語，並玩着你的頭髮。

sentences.english: He muttered, "You cheat on somebody, there's going to be payback.
sentences.chinese: 他喃喃自語，“你背叛別人早晚要得報應的。

sentences.english: “It will be my professional grave,” he muttered to himself.
sentences.chinese: “它會是我的職業墳墓，”他喃喃自語道。

sentences.english: Can you hear those poor troops mumbling after the general rode off?
sentences.chinese: 你能聽到這些士兵騎着馬離開時的喃喃自語嗎？

definition: to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
